reference.shortdesc: The elementdef element specifies an element to which an attribute and set of controlled values are bound.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The elementdef element is specialized from data. It is defined in the subject scheme module.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: , status and base from , , , and the attributes defined below.

dlentry.dd: Specifies the element to which the set of controlled values are bound

example.title: Example
example.p: In this example, the value attribute for the lomDifficulty element is bound to the specified set of values. Processors should limit the values for the value attribute on the lomDifficulty element to the following set of values: easy, medium, or difficult. Other elements that have a value attribute are not affected.
example.codeblock: <subjectScheme> <subjectdef keys="difficulty"> <subjectdef keys="easy"/> <subjectdef keys="medium"/> <subjectdef keys="difficult"/> </subjectdef> <!-- ... --> <enumerationdef> <elementdef name="lomDifficulty"/> <attributedef name="value"/> <subjectdef keyref="difficulty"/> </enumerationdef> </subjectScheme>
